paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Materialized Views
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive views and Hive Materialized views
**File locations:** /labs/data/
**Successful outcome:** Understanding Hive materialized views
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Advanced Hive Programming 

---

%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the files from IMDb
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r tmp
mkdir -p tmp
cd tmp
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.crew.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/name.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.ratings.tsv.gz
gunzip title.basics.tsv.gz
gunzip title.crew.tsv.gz
gunzip name.basics.tsv.gz
gunzip title.ratings.tsv.gz
ls -l

paragraphs.title: Copy the data in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -chmod 777 /user/zeppelin
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.crew.tsv
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.basics.tsv
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/name.basics.tsv
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.ratings.tsv
hdfs dfs -put tmp/title.basics.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -put tmp/title.crew.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -put tmp/name.basics.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -put tmp/title.ratings.tsv /labs/data/

paragraphs.title: Create the movies database

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab

paragraphs.title: 2 - Do some practice queries to become familiar with data

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create two views in the movies database.
Views
-- A view to show all types that are movies and release year.
-- A view to show movies that have been released after 2015. 

~~~
Create VIEW movie_year as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where titletype="movie";

Create VIEW title_releases as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where startYear>2015;



~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 3 - Drop and Create the views
4 - Query the new views. (Limit to 5)
5 - Drop and create the transactional table

paragraphs.title: 7 - Execute a query on the materialized view
8 - Can you delete movie titles from the year 2000 and rebuild the materialized view?

paragraphs.text:
%md
In a new paragraph show the materialied views in the movies database using the command below:
```console
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
show materialized views in movies;
```

%md
**Tip:** You can create a materialized view and store the data in Druid, using the Druid storage Handler

paragraphs.title: 11 - Create your own materialized view

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive materialized view.

paragraphs.title: 8 - Can you delete movie titles from the year 2000 and rebuild the materialized view?
paragraphs.text:
%md
The following code will produce an error because you cannot udpate or delete records in a view
```console
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Delete from mv_movie_title where startYear='2000'
```

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
%angular
%angular
